item.title: Max severity RCE flaw discovered in widely used Apache Parquet
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A maximum severity remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been discovered impacting all versions of Apache Parquet up to and including 1.15.0. [...]

item.title: Hunters International shifts from ransomware to pure data extortion
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Hunters International Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation is shutting down and rebranding with plans to switch to date theft and extortion-only attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft starts testing Windows 11 taskbar icon scaling
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft is testing a new taskbar icon scaling feature that automatically scales down Windows taskbar icons to show more apps when it gets too overcrowded. [...]

item.title: CISA warns of Fast Flux DNS evasion used by cybercrime gangs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: CISA, the FBI, the NSA, and international cybersecurity agencies are calling on organizations and DNS providers to mitigate the "Fast Flux" cybercrime evasion technique used by state-sponsored threat actors and ransomware gangs. [...]

item.title: Ivanti patches Connect Secure zero-day exploited since mid-March
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ivanti has released security updates to patch a critical Connect Secure remote code execution vulnerability exploited by a China-linked espionage actor to deploy malware since at least mid-March 2025. [...]

item.title: Texas State Bar warns of data breach after INC ransomware claims attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The State Bar of Texas is warning it suffered a data breach after the INC ransomware gang claimed to have breached the organization and began leaking samples of stolen data. [...]

item.title: Oracle privately confirms Cloud breach to customers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Oracle has finally acknowledged to some customers that attackers have stolen old client credentials after breaching a "legacy environment" last used in 2017. [...]

item.title: Recent GitHub supply chain attack traced to leaked SpotBugs token
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A cascading supply chain attack on GitHub that targeted Coinbase in March has now been traced back to a single token stolen from a SpotBugs workflow, which allowed a threat actor to compromise multiple GitHub projects. [...]

item.title: Genetic data site openSNP to close and delete data over privacy concerns
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The openSNP project, a platform for sharing genetic and phenotypic data, will shut down on April 30, 2025, and delete all user submissions over privacy concerns and the risk of misuse by authoritarian governments. [...]

item.title: Verizon Call Filter API flaw exposed customers' incoming call history
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in Verizon's Call Filter feature allowed customers to access the incoming call logs for another Verizon Wireless number through an unsecured API request. [...]

item.title: GitHub expands security tools after 39 million secrets leaked in 2024
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 39 million secrets like API keys and account credentials were leaked on GitHub throughout 2024, exposing organizations and users to significant security risks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft adds hotpatching support to Windows 11 Enterprise
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced that hotpatch updates are now available for business customers using Windows 11 Enterprise 24H2 on x64 (AMD/Intel) systems, starting today. [...]
